questions.questionText: What is a checked exception in Java?
questions.correctAnswer: An exception that must be declared or handled in code.
questions.explanation:
A checked exception in Java is an exception that is verified at compile time.

• Compile-time checking
The compiler ensures that checked exceptions are either caught using a try-catch block or declared using the throws keyword.

• Exception hierarchy
Checked exceptions are subclasses of Exception but do not extend RuntimeException.

• Purpose
They are used to represent recoverable conditions that a program can anticipate and handle gracefully.

• Common examples
IOException, SQLException, and FileNotFoundException are typical examples of checked exceptions.
